name: websearchengine
description: Search for selected text on your favorite search engines / websites (add as many as you like, customizable in settings like Google Chrome)

commands.title: Web Search: look up selected text in your search engine of choice

webSearch.searchEngine.markdownDescription:
***Depreciated - use `webSearch.searchEngines` instead***

Search engine to use for the Web Search extension. Replace the query with ```%s```, e.g. ```https://www.google.com/search?q=%s```, the same way as you would when adding additional search engines to the Chrome browser settings.

webSearch.enableContextMenu.markdownDescription: Enable the Web Search context menu item (right click menu) in the editor

webSearch.searchEngines.markdownDescription:
Search engine to use for the Web Search extension. 
***Item*** is the search engine name
***Value*** is the full url with the search query. Replace the query with ```%s```, e.g. ```https://www.google.com/search?q=%s```, the same way as you would when adding additional search engines to the Chrome browser settings.
Add additional search engines using the same format below using the Add Item button.

additionalProperties.description: Item is the name of the search engine. Value is the search engine URL. The URL must contain the query parameter '%s' which will be replaced with the selected text.
